New Records: India's 2/3 is the lowest score at the fall of third wicket from which any team went on to win in men's ODIs.
Key Match Events: KL Rahul's 97* and Virat Kohli's 85 led India to a stunning comeback win.
Ravindra Jadeja's 3 for 28 restricted Australia to 199.
Jasprit Bumrah took 2 for 35 for India.
KL Rahul hit a six off Glenn Maxwell to seal the win for India.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma had said 'I want middle order to prepare for '10 for 3' situations.' Today that situation arrived, and the team stood up.
Post-Match Reflections: KL Rahul said 'There weren't a lot of conversations with Kohli. I had just taken a shower and was hoping to put my feet up for half an hour after the fielding innings, but I had to come in.'
Winning captain Rohit Sharma said 'Good feeling to come out on top. (Bowling and fielding) Magnificent. Especially the fielding. The fielding was something we really put our effort on.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The stadium played Ma Tujhe Salam when India reached the win.
The partnership between KL Rahul and Virat Kohli was terrific but do not forget how the bowlers operated for India.
Jadeja's three was the headline act, but Kuldeep and the rest chipped in too.
Others: Australia will feel disappointed not capitalising after India were 2 for 3.
The crowd was brilliant from word go, and for them to sitting in the heat and cheering says a lot.
